tweets.text:
@Feargal_Sharkey @wakou2 @ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV @thameswater Does anyone else believe that water going into a stream or river from a sewage works should be as clean as if from a tap???
@Britnatureguide @ChrisGPackham @CarlBovisNature @domdyer70 @MeganMcCubbin @ExtinctionR @Lucy_Lapwing @GreeneIndy @HantsIWWildlife @WildlifeTrusts @

Fairford Sewage Works deals a crippling blow to the Cotswolds limestone River Coln yesterday. No evidence of pollution or decline says the @EnvAgency as it dies before our eyes @KenGoodwinITV https://t.co/Bs7fI3JISi

tweets.text: @ashsmith43 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV Windrush has had publicity - well done @ashsmith43 - but its twin river the Coln is also suffering.
@simongarrard2 @thetimes @10DowningStreet @EnvAgency Never say never my friend.
@Feargal_Sharkey @thetimes @10DowningStreet @EnvAgency Finally papers taking note . Too late now,  and as if boris would give a monkey's.

"Rivers of Shame," today's @thetimes editorial.

Curious as to why @10DowningStreet are putting up with all of this. They must have realised by now that they've got a major liability on the hands and it's called the @EnvAgency. 

 https://t.co/SAVei8xunt

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @thetimes I wonder why you have not been leading a very public campaign over the past years to highlight the funding you need? Is it a huge ask that rivers are guaranteed safe to can swim in and good for other recreational pursuits and not depleted by over-extraction?

Showers are expected this weekend. We are monitoring the situation and our teams are ready to respond. #Beprepared and make sure you‚Äôre #floodaware by checking for #flood alerts and warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/RsLt2Wr2yq

The UK's wild oyster population has declined over 95% due to over-harvesting, habitat loss & pollution.

We're delighted to be working with the @Wild_Oysters project and @EnvAgencyYNE to restore the 20,000 square kilometres of oyster reefs lost in the North East of England ü¶™ https://t.co/mvspWHXO8k

tweets.text: @claireiz1 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV ¬£60 billion profit helped them look in the other direction. As for the EA, well that's a mystery for now.
@ashsmith43 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV I thought all this had stopped back in the 80's üò≥.... How can these people not have nightmares when they close their eyes üò©

#LondonRiversWeek is nearly over for 2020...

...but here's Neil, from our team of experts, in SW London...

Knows a thing or two about rivers... 

He's got some advice on how to stop river #pollution from homes and businesses... Anywhere...
#LRW2020 @RBKingston https://t.co/gqNrbLQXE5

The reinstatement of the split channel at Cherry Holme will provided #river #habitats & increase #aquatic #biodiversity. The restoration of the previously filled in channel will help to reduce the impact of #flooding downstream. #LetNatureHelp @EnvAgencyMids @StaffsWildlife https://t.co/5bskho6N5H

tweets.text:
@ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV According to last year's data, in 2019 @thameswater spent 2,207 hours, the equivalent of 92 whole days, dumping sewage into the River Coln from the Fairford sewage plant.

"Exceptional circumstance"? https://t.co/trky5H39u8

With the work to divert part of the #RiverTrent in #Stoke-on-Trent almost finished, today our biodiversity team has been in the river rescuing fish before the new channel is finally connected. #StaffsSUNRISE @WildStoke @StaffsWT @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/MKf6emYUEA

Our Field Teams across the #NorthWest are constantly inspecting screens and clearing them of debris in order to reduce potential #flood risk. 

Like here at Down Brook in Makerfield, #Wigan.

Make sure you are prepared. Sign up to receive flood warnings üëâhttps://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/gikBz1Jnm6

Our Officers are talking to residents, clearing grids and checking assets across the North West in preparation of the heavy showers expected over the next few days. #beprepared and make sure to check if you‚Äôre at risk: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/nLKdyDqBcQ
Fantastic work @EnvAgencyMids - we think the fish will definitely prefer their new home üòÉüêü https://t.co/Yj1qelPwoa

@pow_rebecca @GeorgeEustice_ @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @Channel4News @mrjamesob @piersmorgan @Telegraph Lawbreaking, corrupt, ecocidal, unaffordable & obsolete! What will it take to stop this destruction of our countryside? #NHSnotHS2 #boriskeepyourpromise @BorisJohnson @nadams https://t.co/8g6VbP6h92

tweets.text: @LimpenhoeGirl @N_Rivers_Trust @jamesowild @EnvAgency @ChalkStreamMon @Feargal_Sharkey @WildTroutTrust In Medieval times it was the River Gay as it springs pop up in the village of Gayton. The wood being added later as it flowed through a large woodland before entering Kings Lynn where the Victorians appreciated its beauty & made it a feature in the Walks (park)

@DefraGovUK is having to issue multiple statements to defend its record on river pollution as criticism over the @EnvAgency's regulation of the water sector‚Äôs sewage discharges into rivers and seas intensifies.
https://t.co/qyu09BZQ31

@Only1MaxyD @SalfordCouncil @EnvAgency @KeepBritainTidy Hi
This area, North Bay at the rear of The Alchemist, belongs to Peel Ports so you would need to report this to them. We have just cleared 20 tonnes of debris from the sections of water that belong to us.
Thanks
Louise

The Gaywood River  Once provided Kings Lynn with its drinking water at Kettle Mills where iron buckets pulled up the crystal clear water Bawsey ruins site of a Time Team dig 1990‚Äôs @N_Rivers_Trust @jamesowild @EnvAgency @ChalkStreamMon @Feargal_Sharkey @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/mfZSNLvp2x

Looking good is this section of the ¬£30 million #Burton-upon-Trent #flood defence scheme near Paget High School.

It should be accessible to the public in the coming weeks with more sections opened progressively until project is completed next spring #flooding #Staffordshire https://t.co/NaFgysxvuj
What‚Äôs a 3D Buffer Zone? How do I get one? How will it address water quality and wider issues? See our report: https://t.co/f1JhkdWVfl @EnvAgency @Forest_Research https://t.co/603nn9z0GH

@whynothomer Finally, if you're free next Thursday at 11am, #BBC1 is showing how we took @thameswater to court for the Oxfordshire pollution I mentioned earlier. A programme called #DefendersUK. Or watch it later. Thanks for your interest in our work.

We are pleased to welcome Karen Alford to our event. Karen is Flood and Coast Risk Manager @EnvAgency  and she will join us to discuss 'Asset Performance Management: Who benefits? What could we expect?'. Learn more and register: https://t.co/ccXCTawIVj https://t.co/orXKJ9ERRK

Heavy rain is expected in Yorkshire over the weekend. Our teams are working hard to check our flood defences. 

Pictured are flood defences they have strengthened in Todmorden #Calderdale. #PrepareActSurvive 
https://t.co/HNBU0rgQzk https://t.co/PYpv46pwBX
